privateDatabase_dashboard_guide_help: Need help with your private databases?
privateDatabase_dashboard_cpu_saturation: Time spent with CPU throttled over the last 24 hours.
privateDatabase_dashboard_information: The server is in an idle state. Some features are therefore disabled.
privateDatabase_dashboard_changeversion_: Migrating server. Some features are disabled as a result.
privateDatabase_dashboard_not_administra: You are not the database administrator.
privateDatabase_dashboard_hostname_toolt: Please use the host name provided to connect to your instance, as the IP address associated with it may change over time.
privateDatabase_dashboard_certificate_to: You do not need a certificate for connecting to your instance. However, it is required if you would like to encrypt the connection to it.
privateDatabase_dashboard_admin_informat: Refer to the users and rights tab
privateDatabase_configuration_alert: Any changes will result in the server rebooting.
privateDatabase_configuration_reboot: The configuration is being changed. Your server will restart.
privateDatabase_configuration_error_put: An error occurred when modifying the configuration.
privateDatabase_configuration_error: An error has occurred retrieving the data.
privateDatabase_configuration_success: Your server has restarted and the configuration was successful.
privateDatabase_configuration_autoCommit: Defines whether or not auto-commit mode is enabled, i.e. if SQL transactions have automatically been committed, or if they need to be committed in order to work.
privateDatabase_configuration_skipInnodb: Disable the use of InnoDB tables.
privateDatabase_configuration_tmpdir: This is a directory of temporary files. /dev/shm refers to RAM storage for extra performance, whereas /tmp refers to hard disk storage (recommended for occasional resource-intensive transactions).
privateDatabase_configuration_interactiv: The number of seconds of inactivity during a command line connection, after which the server closes the connection.
privateDatabase_configuration_wait_timeo: The number of seconds of inactivity during an external connection, after which the server closes the connection.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_auto: Defines whether SQL transactions are automatically submitted or not.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_even: Is used to trigger the execution of requests programmed directly on the MySQL server.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_inno: Choice of buffer size (in megabytes). Cannot exceed 50% of RAM.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_inte: Number of seconds for which the server will wait for activity on an interactive connection before closing the connection.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_max_: Number of concurrent connections authorised on Private SQL.
Number of concurrent connections authorised per user.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_sql_: The “sql_mode” option affects the supported SQL syntax and data validation checks performed by MySQL/MariaDB.
privateDatabase_configuration_field_tmpd: Temporary file folder (RAM or hard disk of the instance).
privateDatabase_configuration_field_wait: Time for which the server will wait for activity on a non-interactive connection before closing the connection (in seconds).
privateDatabase_capability_disabled_expl: This feature is not available for this database type.
privateDatabase_tabs_user_grant_ro_toolt: Authorisation of the following query: Select
privateDatabase_tabs_user_grant_rw_toolt: Authorisation of the following queries: Select/Insert/Update/Delete
privateDatabase_no_db: You do not have a database
privateDatabase_tabs_users_grant_error_d: You cannot change the rights of a user who is being deleted.

privateDatabase_order_step1_hosting_warn: Private SQL is only compatible with hosting packages in the same datacenter, such as the one selected. If you would like to use another hosting plan on your account, or a hosting plan on another account and you do not know which datacenter it is located in, you can find this information in the ‘General information’ tab of this hosting plan.
privateDatabase_order_step1_hosting_info: Private SQL should be installed in the same datacenter as the hosting plan
privateDatabase_order_step1_no_hosting_w: Private SQL is only compatible with hosting packages in the same datacenter. If you have a hosting plan on another account and do not know which datacenter it is in, log in to the other account and retrieve this information in the ‘General information’ tab of your hosting plan.
privateDatabase_order_step1_clouddb_warn: Please note, CloudDB is not compatible with OVH web hosting plans.
